title: Seven Layer Salad Recipe
description: Make this 7-layer salad in a large glass bowl so dinner guests can see all the pretty layers and delicious ingredients. Everybody loves this salad!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Layered Seven Layer Salad 4.7 (734) 570 Reviews 64 Photos This 7-layer salad looks great in a large glass bowl. I usually make it with bacon, lettuce, red onion, pea, Cheddar cheese, and cauliflower but you can vary the type of onions, cheese, etc. There's never too much because everybody loves it! Submitted by Leah Mae Updated on April 10, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 64 64 64 64 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe There's a reason this vintage 7-layer salad has stood the test of time: It's easy to make, has gorgeous layers of crisp lettuce, colorful vegetables, crumbled bacon, and cheese that'll please everyone at your party. Seven Layer Salad Ingredients These are the ingredients you'll need to make this seven layer salad recipe: · For the salad: a pound of bacon, iceberg lettuce, a red onion, a package of frozen peas, shredded Cheddar cheese, and a cup of chopped cauliflower.· For the dressing: mayonnaise, grated Parmesan cheese, and white sugar. How to Make Seven Layer Salad You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this easy seven layer salad: 1. Cook the bacon.2. Assemble the salad.3. Make the dressing and drizzle over the salad. Can You Make Seven Layer Salad Ahead of Time? Yes, seven layer salad makes a great make-ahead recipe because it's served chilled. However, since some of the ingredients (particularly the iceberg lettuce) lose their crispness quickly, you'll want to serve it within one or two days. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "This is the best salad … makes a lot," says Betty Nelson. "You may think that the dressing isn't going to be enough … but it is and so delicious!" "I made it exactly as instructed, but added chopped green onions that I had on hand," according to Alina Aimee Guillen. "This salad went over really well and everyone came back for more!" "Delicious," raves Gina Uebel. "Loved the cauliflower. I also added carrots for flavor and color." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings Salad: 1 pound bacon 1 large head iceberg lettuce - rinsed, dried, and chopped 1 red onion, chopped 1 (10 ounce) package frozen green peas, thawed 10 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese 1 cup chopped cauliflower Dressing: 1 ¼ cups mayonnaise ⅔ cup grated Parmesan cheese 2 tablespoons white sugar Directions Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels; crumble and set aside. To make the salad: Place chopped lettuce in a large glass dish or bowl; top with a layer of red onion, peas, shredded cheese, cauliflower, and bacon. To make the dressing: Whisk mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, and sugar together in a bowl until smooth. Drizzle over salad and refrigerate until chilled. Add Your Photo Photos of Seven Layer Salad 01 of 64 Photo by  MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS 02 of 64 Photo by  WobblyApple2952 05/23/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort A keeper! I added chopped eggs, sliced grape tomatoes and scallions. I also added a pinch of pepper and lemon juice to the dressing (seen in another recipe post ). It was great and looked amazing 03 of 64 Photo by  LMBROWN-BAKER 11/28/2023 I love this salad. It is my go to whenever I need to take a salad. I also like boiled eggs in mine. 04 of 64 Photo by  janey625 09/08/2023 The recipe is good - I used a trifle bowl and it looked pretty and tasted good too. 05 of 64 Photo by  Candy Malaspina 04/10/2023 I made this for Easter and brought it in to work. Everyone raved about it and loved the dressing with mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese and sugar! I followed the recipe exactly, only used Bibb lettuce instead of regular lettuce.This photo was after it had all been devoured! 06 of 64 Photo by  Silvia 05/15/2022 This Salad was a big hit at our annual cousin’s luncheon. I substituted the cauliflower with 6 hard boiled eggs and also added tomatoes . I used lite mayo and no one noticed. Delish! 07 of 64 Photo by  robgraphics 05/04/2022 Great base recipe, which is why I gave it 5 stars. Not too often that recipes are perfect to individual taste.I added a seeded diced cucumber, sliced olives, a shredded carrot, and croutons.I made the dressing as listed in the recipe to taste before adding 2 tsp red wine vinegar and a teaspoon of homemade buttermilk ranch dry mix. Like others, I reduced the sugar to 1 tsp. 08 of 64 Photo by  Trusted Brands 08/24/2021 09 of 64 Photo by  ShuJen l 01/10/2021 This salad is mind blowing delicious! I don’t even know how to describe it but it’s super good. I put eggs in mine and added sour cream to the mayo dressing like others suggested. I also used turkey bacon. I didn’t layer it quite correctly as far as the dressing in between the veggies. I put all the veggies on and was going for the bacon and thought I don’t want soggy bacon. Lol that’s when I realized might not have layered it correctly lol. Anyways I added the dressing then put eggs, bacon, and cheese on top. I choose a sheet pan because I didn’t have a glass bowl.
